sub_title: Port Ecosystems Expert | Business Developer | Education Innovator | Reseacher | Erasmus University Rotterdam
summary:
Maurice is an expert in Port Strategy, Management and Environment. Maurice is a real connector and puts the human factor and human capital at the centre of port-city development. Maurice is highly interested in the ‘tensions’ in port cities. Where the port and the city meet there is dynamism, conflicts arise, but there is also room for creativity.

At Erasmus UPT Maurice concentrates on issues such as:
• How can ports and port cities develop sustainably, thereby striking a balance between economic and social values.
• The development of innovative education solutions which helps professionals worldwide to excel in the dynamic problems that ports and port cities face.

Maurice is an expert in the following research themes:

• Port-City ecosystems
• Inclusive (social and sustainable) port development
• Coordination mechanisms in port partnerships
• Serious game development port, shipping and logistics
• Zero waste supply chains

Maurice considers ports and port cities as breeding grounds for talent, innovation and entrepreneurship. From this perspective, he supports policy and initiatives that lead to a breakthrough in unruly port and port city issues.

You can always call Maurice to act as a facilitator, moderator or reporter of knowledge-intensive meetings. As a coach or sparring partner he often knows how to bring out the best in people. You can count on Maurice when you need creativity, look for structure or want to capture knowledge in a clear and concise mind map, case study, game session or other innovative way of working.

projects.title: Research on port and capacity development in international perspective
projects.description: Port infrastructure is a precondition for economic development. Human resource development is a key enabler for making transport and port infrastructure more efficient and to be able to develop sustainable economic clusters where companies can innovate. It seems that investments in such vital physical and knowledge infrastructure are not developed in synchronisation and approached from different viewpoints and with involvement of different stakeholders. As a result, port development stagnate, economic development is hampered and countries waste enourmous amounts of resources, both financial as well as human capital. I am interested in this field, particularly to better understand the process of port infrastructure and to provide a holistic view on synchronised development with the right partners on board at the right time in the development process.

projects.title: Study on the conditions for the sustainable development of Lake Tanganyika Transport Corridor
projects.description:
The Netherlands is actively involved in infrastructure investments to develop African transport corridors to boost regional markets and trade. To facilitate strategic decision making and a coordinated donor approach, as well as to avoid investments in potentially competing projects, more information is needed about the supra-regional transport systems. The Netherlands Development Agency has commissioned Erasmus UPT to conduct a research study to contribute to the sustainable development of the Lake Tanganyika Transport Corridor (LTTC). 
The study provides a regional perspective on maritime transport corridor development, using a systematic corridor assessment as well as a cost and transit time comparison with the Northern, Central and Southern Corridors. The findings from this report support the formulation of a shared vision for the government authorities in the riparian countries, based on the foundations of collaboration and a joint approach to corridor development.

contributors.headline: Port Ecosystems Expert | Business Developer | Education Innovator | Reseacher | Erasmus University Rotterdam

projects.title: Rotterdam; home port for talent
projects.description: Erasmus UPT recently completed a study on talent and talentprofiles in the Rotterdam regional economy with an additional study focusing on talent for the maritime sector. The researchers conducted a content-analysis on job vacancies, set out a survey and conducted interviews. The researchers witnessed a acceleration of technological developments which causes a lot of dynamics. Particularly DevOps innovation teams accelerate the time-to market. The maritime labour market is highly international and technology driven. Craftsmanship is still paramount, but having the right cross-over skills enables talent to make real impact in innovation teams. There are numerous initiatives to find, attract, retain and grow maritime talent. Education, business and intermediaries are in close contact with each other. More diversity and talent targeting will lead to a larger talent pool, more influx from a more diverse background as well as allow professionals to make the cross-over to the maritime sector.

projects.title: Port Executive Leadership Circle
projects.description: The Port Executive Leadership Circle is a unique and specific educational programme has been developed by Erasmus University Rotterdam and Port of Rotterdam, using their combined knowledge and expertise. The programme builds leadership skills for port executives, based on their existing knowledge and expertise, and is specialised for the environment of port-based industries: The Port Executive Leadership Circle.

projects.title: Masterclass Series on Shipping and Transport
projects.description: The Masterclasses Shipping and Transport offer a platform for knowledge exchange between young professionals in the maritime and port industrial cluster, in cooperation with education, business community and (young) port association. The Masterclass uses the accumulated knowledge of the Master Shipping and Transport program of STC-Group's Netherlands Maritime University as the backbone, and invites key note speakers from the maritime and port sector to showcase best practices or to give market insights and updates to the young ambitious port professionals.

contributors.headline: Port Ecosystems Expert | Business Developer | Education Innovator | Reseacher | Erasmus University Rotterdam

projects.title: 16th AIVP World Port City Conference 'Next Generation Port City'
projects.description: Maurice acted as rapporteur and was responsible for facilitating workshops relating the the conference team 'Training, learning, creativity: my education Next Generation'. Ports all over the world face similar challenges. When it comes to the Next Generation, we are all part of this Next Generation port citizens. We are all part of the problem ànd the solution. But there is no one size fits all. Each pair of city and port has an own identity. Where one port owes its size and position to favorable deep water, the other is situated downstream in a river delta, while another port may be protected by a coral reef. In port-cities we need to strive for sustainable value added, for the communities ports are embedded in. We have to mobilize port citizens from the bottom-up, make them part of this living city, and learn them how to adapt to ever faster changes. In the Next Generation Port-City existing and arriving citizens will find a sense of place. For them to make a contribution we have to nurture our port-city cultures. More of his conclusions can be found on the AIVP World Port City Conference website.

contributors.headline: Port Ecosystems Expert | Business Developer | Education Innovator | Reseacher | Erasmus University Rotterdam
Director at LH Port Center

projects.title: Case study development for port strategy, operations and hinterland logistics
projects.description: Cases are part of the curriculum of the Master Shipping and Transport at Netherlands Maritime University (STC-NMU). In order to become qualified as a master, development of skills is equally important as development of knowledge. The objectives of a case driven method of learning is to develop new knowledge, apply knowledge, make informed judgements, as well to improve communication skills. As the case study work is spread out over a longer period of time, students have sufficient time to reflect and improve based on feedback. In other words, a case driven approach will prepare student for a steering their own learning process. The following case studies are developed: port internationalisation case, hinterland strategy case, hinterland modal shift case, port operations case, terminal management case.

projects.title: Centrum voor Innovatief Vakmanschap 'Logisticus van de Toekomst' / Centre of Excellence 'Logistician of the Future'
projects.description: In my role as project manager, my ambition is to enhance innovation in logistics as well as to increase the inflow of students into the logistics sector via a continuous interaction between business and education. In our Centre of Excellence we focus on three themes within the Logistics Human Capital Agenda. 1) in search of excellence for the logistics professional; 2) align qualifications with logistics activities in the region, 3) strengthen knowledge circulation and stimulate life long learning.

contributors.headline: Port Ecosystems Expert | Business Developer | Education Innovator | Reseacher | Erasmus University Rotterdam

projects.title: Serious game development Port Constructor
projects.description: Port Constructor seeks to enhance learning about concepts relating to port development and management. The game design is built on both practical and theoretical knowledge and understanding from port developers, educators and scientists. By means of a digital game, the game developers have initially decoupled port development and management concepts from its context, thereby taking a conceptual perspective on port development and management. The second stage of development was to define archetypes of ports, basic port functions as well as provide an overview of port dilemmas. The map editor allows configuration to any port dilemma in any port location.  Development team consisted of experts from Port of Rotterdam, TU Delft, STC Group, UNESCO-IHE and INTHERE. The project was funded by SmartPort.

contributors.headline: Port Ecosystems Expert | Business Developer | Education Innovator | Reseacher | Erasmus University Rotterdam

projects.title: Port Discovery Study Trip Sohar Oman
projects.description: The study tour to the port of Sohar was done as an integral of the MSc Shipping and Transport program, a maritime driven management program. The International Maritime College Oman served as our host location from where students and faculty visited the port authority, terminal operating companies, iron ore processing plant, logistics companies and the ministry of transport and communications. Weekends were spent with touristic places such as Muscat, Al Rustaq and Nizwa. Students were assigned to deliver a port discovery paper with special focus on identifying critical success factors of the suceess of port of Sohar as an emerging port industrial cluster in the Middle East.

profile_positions.description: PortCityFutures brings together a highly engaged research community of researchers from Leiden, Delft and Rotterdam universities, who are interested in the spaces, the governance and the culture of port-city regions. As a co-founder and core team member, I have (a.o.) been active in network building, organisation and speaking at conferences, education development (MOOC), and drafting business plans, evaluation reports.
profile_positions.title: Core Team Member and Co-founder LDE PortCityFutures
Senior Researcher / Business developer

profile_positions.description:
Building ports with partnerships; how can inclusive public-private port partnerships contribute to a more balanced way of port development in which local partners can capture the long term value coming from knowledge and skills transfer between multinationals and local partners?
This research aims to contribute to the articulation of conditions, success factors for knowledge transfer within partnerships and the role of knowledge and research institutes as an enabler within developing port clusters.

profile_positions.description:
Developing a Centre of Excellence in Logistics (Centrum voor Innovatief Vakmanschap) as a public-private partnership between education and business. 

Conducting knowledge management projects in the field of supply chain management and port strategy. 

Developing case studies for educational purpose in relation to port development, hinterland strategy and modal shift.

profile_positions.title: Senior Innovation, Research and Development Manager in Shipping and Transport

profile_positions.description:
Maurice is the Head of Netherlands Maritime University, a department of STC-group, Maurice is responsible for the Master degree program Shipping and Transport. This Master is unique in the world as it is set up to run in two locations in the world: Rotterdam (The Netherlands) and Gwangyang (Korea). Maurice is responsible for the curriculum development, recruitment and selection of team of lecturers as well as for the execution of the program at STC-Group's main campus in Rotterdam as well as at STC-Korea, a branch school of the STC-Group.

Previously, in his position as Senior Project Manager he was responsible for the establishment and implementation of STC-Korea as the first accredited Foreign Educational Institution in Korea.
profile_positions.title: Department Director Netherlands Maritime University

profile_positions.description:
UTi Worldwide is an international, non-asset-based global integrated logistics company providing supply chain management and optimization solutions. Our services include air and ocean freight forwarding, contract logistics, distribution, customs brokerage and other supply chain management services including consulting. 

UTi Supply Chain Solutions is an internal consulting unit providing supply chain planning and optimization services to UTi’s key accounts. 

Activities include:
- Conduct strategic value assessments for customers to identify improvements areas within their supply chains
- Assist key customers designing and implementing solutions that improve the predictability and visibility and reduce the overall costs of their supply chains. 
- Manage large implementation projects of new transactional freight forwarding / contract logistics business
- Business development / tender management
- Develop and train UTi employees in Project Management Skills
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant Supply Chain Solutions

profile_positions.description: Advising profit and non-profit organisations in logistics, supply chain management & finance.
profile_positions.title: Consultant
